definition: to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to be drawn into/to be involved in
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 卷心菜[juan3 xin1 cai4]
hand scroll (horizontal format for Chinese landscape painting)/hand roll (Japanese: temaki, style of fish cuisine)/hand rolled cigarette/hand roll (many contexts)/roll up

sentences.english: The wind fell little red, winter cold.
sentences.chinese: 風捲落紅點點，冬意清寒。

sentences.english: This volume contains selections from his early works.
sentences.chinese: 該捲包含了他的早期作品文選。

sentences.english: Cutting edge rolling pin rolls, cuts, and stores all in one.
sentences.chinese: 擀麪杖捲刃，割傷，並存儲於一身。

sentences.english: A scientist said they were probably picked up by a waterspout or mini-tornado out at sea.
sentences.chinese: 科學家說它們很可能是被龍捲風從海上捲來的。

sentences.english: Although the wind turned the tides time and time again against him.
sentences.chinese: 儘管風捲得如浪潮一樣一次又一次地阻擋他。

sentences.english: The wind was whipping waves of sleet across the pond.
sentences.chinese: 寒風捲着雨夾雪，在池塘上肆虐。

sentences.english: A series of towering waves swept away thousands of people.
sentences.chinese: 連續的高浪捲走了無數的人。

sentences.english: Rip currents are so strong that they can carry swimmers away from shore before they know what's happening.
sentences.chinese: 強流來勢兇猛，會在不知不覺問把游泳者捲走。

sentences.english: The wind swept us along towards the north.
Like heath that, in the wilderness, The wild wind whirls away.
sentences.chinese: 像荒野中的石楠被一陣狂風捲走。

sentences.english: Seven Black Plaid Shorts over the knee, with white and smooth skin.
sentences.chinese: 七分黑格子短褲捲過了膝蓋，露出潔白光滑的肌膚。

sentences.english: No matter when you sit down in summer, you always roll up your pants to your keens.
sentences.chinese: 在夏天，不管什麼時候坐下，你都把褲腳捲到膝蓋邊。

sentences.english: And I will scatter them as stubble, which is carried away by the wind in the desert.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，我必使他們四散，像被曠野裏的風捲去的草芥。

sentences.english: The wind of anguish still hauls on them as usual.
sentences.chinese: 苦惱之風依然捲走它們一如往昔。

sentences.english: I keep thinking that bag of film.
Many children would rather eat ice cream from cones than from dishes.
sentences.chinese: 許多小孩喜歡喫蛋捲冰淇淋勝過盤裝冰淇淋。

definition: to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
have as remainder/trad. variant of 剩[sheng4]
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
